nodes.bodyText: Static import of startsWith reads better compared with StringStartsWith.startsWith.
why not use java.lang.String.startsWith()? In not, because that method is much more familiar, this really can't be a static import.

String.startsWith would give a message got false expected true.
This StringStartsWith.startsWith gives more clear message: got: "11.0.4", expected: a string starting with "1.8.0".
Fair enough. Static import is still not a good idea here given the confusion with the better known String.startsWith method.
